channel.title: 数字花园
channel.description: 最近的10条笔记 on 数字花园

item.title: Hosting
item.description: Quartz effectively turns your Markdown files and other resources into a bundle of HTML, JS, and CSS files (a website!).

item.title: Authoring Content
item.description: All of the content in your Quartz should go in the /content folder. The content for the home page of your Quartz lives in content/index.md.

item.title: Architecture
item.description: Quartz is a static site generator.

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Quartz is meant to be extremely configurable, even if you don’t know any coding.

item.title: Upgrading Quartz
item.description: Note This is specifically a guide for upgrading Quartz 4 version to a more recent update.

item.title: Layout
item.description: Certain emitters may also output HTML files. To enable easy customization, these emitters allow you to fully rearrange the layout of the page.

item.title: Area
item.description: Want to create your own custom component? Check out the advanced guide on creating components for more information.

item.title: Making your own plugins
item.description: Warning This part of the documentation will assume you have working knowledge in TypeScript and will include code snippets that describe the interface of what Quartz plugins should look like.

item.title: Migrating from Quartz 3
item.description: As you already have Quartz locally, you don’t need to fork or clone it again.

item.title: Creating your own Quartz components
item.description: Warning This guide assumes you have experience writing JavaScript and are familiar with TypeScript.
